findings.title: Deployer cannot mint after initial deployment
findings.description: The deployer of the contract loses the ability to mint new tokens after the initial deployment.

findings.title: Deployer cannot block user
findings.description: The deployer does not have the capability to block users.

findings.title: Deployer can lock contract
findings.description: The deployer has the capability to lock the contract, which may lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method

findings.title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount
findings.description: The contract uses a hardcoded gas amount for message calls, which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Hash Collisions with Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: This vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass authentication by capturing and replaying a hash collision, potentially leading to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the code which can lead to irrelevant code and potential security risks.

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: The finding indicates a potential vulnerability where an arbitrary jump can occur with a function type variable, which may lead to unintended behavior or security risks.

findings.title: Insufficient Gas Griefing
findings.description: The contract may allow an attacker to drain the gas of a transaction by repeatedly calling a function with low gas limits.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: Improper Following of Specification by Caller (CWE-573)

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: Improper verification of cryptographic signature allowing signature replay attacks.
